result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keriyante D Fletcher-Watson appeared by video.  Attorney Jason Canfield appeared by video for Keriyante D Fletcher-Watson.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status conference. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($15,000.00) LW

Defendant Keriyante D Fletcher-Watson in court.  Attorney Jason Canfield appeared by video for Keriyante D Fletcher-Watson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Attorney Canfield needs more time to meet with his client.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Branch PE.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report , filed.

Defendant Keriyante D Fletcher-Watson in court.  Attorney Megan Newport for John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status of counsel. Defendant does qualify for PD representation, however has not been appointed counsel. For reasons stated on the record the Court will appoint  counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Jason Canfield to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant DOES NOT HAVE TO REPAY Milwaukee County for attorney fees. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Atty Canfield  in court and accepts appointment. Court finds good cause to extend prelim time limits. Case adjourned for prelim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Keriyante D Fletcher-Watson in court.  Attorney John J Rejowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled. Defendant present. Court orders warrant vacated and reinstates bail with all previous conditions. PD's office did not appoint for today's hearing. Case adjourned for status of counsel in Br. 4.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Keriyante D Fletcher-Watson not in court.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Keriyante D Fletcher-Watson in court with attorney Thomas Holland Reed.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for State V Lee hearing. Court orders filing sent to court showing the efforts made to appoint counsel. Matter set for status of counsel. Court finds good cause to extend preliminary time limits for representation to be appointed. 
Case remains calendared in Br 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Keriyante D Fletcher-Watson in court by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

Defendant Keriyante D Fletcher-Watson in court.   Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defendant is reminded of the no contact order that remains in effect.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Gerald Deshea Anderson, Pamela Swanson, Krishna Carter, and co-defendants.

Defendant Keriyante D Fletcher-Watson in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/10/2022@1p
